item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Bruce Lee
item.description: "Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one" -- Bruce Lee

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Let us never forget to pray. God lives. He is near. He is real. He is not only aware of us but cares for us. He is our Father. He is accessible to all who will seek Him." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Any concern too small to be turned into a prayer is too small to be made into a burden." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oswald Chambers
item.description:
"We tend to use prayer as a last resort, but God wants it to be our first line of defense. We pray when there's nothing else we can do, but God wants us to pray before we do anything at all.
Most of us would prefer, however, to spend our time doing something that will get immediate results. We don't want to wait for God to resolve matters in His good time because His idea of 'good time' is seldom in sync with ours." -- Oswald Chambers

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Fanny J. Crosby
item.description: "God will answer you prayers better than you think. Of course, one will not always get exactly what he has asked for....We all have sorrows and disappointments, but one must never forget that, if commended to God, they will issue in good....His own solution is far better than any we could conceive." -- Fanny J. Crosby

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Why must people kneel down to pray? If I really wanted to pray I’ll tell you what I'd do. I'd go out into a great big field all alone or in the deep, deep woods and I'd look up into the sky—up—up—up—into that lovely blue sky that looks as if there was no end to its blueness. And then I'd just feel a prayer." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: "In the end, the number of prayers we say may contribute to our happiness, but the number of prayers we answer may be of even greater importance." -- Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Help" is a prayer that is always answered. It doesn't matter how you pray--with your head bowed in silence, or crying out in grief, or dancing. Churches are good for prayer, but so are garages and cars and mountains and showers and dance floors. Years ago I wrote an essay that began, "Some people think that God is in the details, but I have come to believe that God is in the bathroom." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Toba Beta [Betelgeuse Incident]
item.description: "Many people pray to be kept out of unexpected problems. Some people pray to be able to confront and overcome them." -- Toba Beta [Betelgeuse Incident]

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by D.L. Moody
item.description: "He who kneels the most, stands the best." -- D.L. Moody

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Gavin de Becker
item.description: "Most men fear getting laughed at or humiliated by a romantic prospect while most women fear rape and death." -- Gavin de Becker

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Gavin De Becker
Elizabeth add a quote by Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: "No misfortune is so bad that whining about it won’t make it worse. (Apr 2007 Gen Conf)" -- Jeffrey R. Holland
